description: Number of edges in 5-partite Turán graph of order n.
comments: Apart from the initial term this is the elliptic troublemaker sequence R_n(1,5) (also sequence R_n(4,5)) in the notation of Stange (see Table 1, p.16). For other elliptic troublemaker sequences R_n(a,b) see the cross references below. - _Peter Bala_, Aug 12 2013
references: R. L. Graham et al., eds., Handbook of Combinatorics, Vol. 2, p. 1234.
links: K. E. Stange, Integral points on elliptic curves and explicit valuations of division polynomials arXiv:1108.3051v3 [math.NT], 2011-2014.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Turán Graph
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-1,0,0,1,-2,1).
formula: G.f.: (x^5+x^4+x^3+x^2)/((1-x^5)*(1-x)^2).a(n) = sum(A011558(k)*(n-k): 0<=k<=n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 30 2009a(n) = floor( 2n^2/5 ). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 20 2013
prog: (MAGMA) [Floor(2*n^2 div 5): n in [0..60]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 20 2015(PARI) a(n)=2*n^2\5 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 20 2015
crossrefs: Elliptic troublemaker sequences: A007590 (= R_n(2,4)), A030511 (= R_n(2,6) = R_n(4,6)), A184535 (= R_n(2,5) = R_n(3,5)).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
